title: Player behavior gets worse every year.  5 years, quitting. 3 perma banned accounts
body:
I've toyed with player behavior over the years. Like the title says, I HAVE BEEN PERMABANNED 3 times. Maybe 4, I don't even remember. I consider accounts disposable and I stopped buying anything with real money. I poked and prodded at players who decided to waste my time. By Riot's rules I absolutely deserved every ban, except the first one. I was banned for sarcasm and arrogance the first time, for brushing off stupid behavior by having some individual character. Sorry Riot, sorry for being arrogant in the midst of garbage behavior.  

 Riot has the "safe place" philosophy. Anything that upsets anyone can be reported, and where there is smoke there is fire.

 My problem, and the main reason I have more insight into bad behavior is that I have always had non-meta builds. Not troll builds, but not popular, at least at the moment I used them. Many became meta but that's not the point. My builds and playstyle  can get me to Plat-Diamond SOLO. Every tier has difference behavioral challenges to face, and to a lesser degree gameplay. The majority of players think the grass is greener higher up, it's not. There are players in Plat and Diamond that are just as dumb as toxic as lower ranks. (And when I say dumb, I mean in game only! I know from real life experience some players just turn into idiots when they login.) 

 I faced an onslaught of ignorant behavior from players who look for a reason to blame when a game goes bad. It is common for a player to press tab and LOOK FOR A REASON TO BE MAD after a play goes wrong, or an enemy play goes right.  If you play your own builds, you will face every bit of toxicity this game has to offer nearly every losing game. Even worse, every game that is still completely winnable, but your team gave up and is now blaming you while being tilted. 

 I call it Moba Mental Illness. Players have very specific and reliable responses to in-game occurrences. I know what they are mad about, almost word for word what they will say, and how to stand my ground with logic. AND I DO IT FREELY.  When I do it in excess I feel the ban coming, and I push it further, I throw in some verbal Kung Fu, I teach lessons. Feelings are hurt for the overall purpose of good. 

 Riot says to ignore and report. Right? The threads of "how you are supposed to behave" are sewn into this game, but they don't work.  I've turned chat off for months. Like I mentioned, I take most of the blame in situations where I'm off meta, that means my teammates are being toxic at me. By ignoring them, do I just report them all and just assume they are toxic? If my team decides my gameplay is the problem, so they start using their keyboard to launch their stock phrases meant to insult and blame, are they reporting each other? 

 If a player stops trying (but does not blatantly quit) while blaming others, teammates are likely to bandwagon in and feel hopeless. The players who stop trying are now the majority, and they bandwagon report the player who got ganked/had bad game/off meta build. In this scenario, does the report system make the game better? NO. IT EMPOWERS BAD BEHAVIOR THAT SPREADS LIKE A VIRUS.  

Nobody is standing up for logic anymore. There is no natural social regulation. The strict chat log based-no context based ban system devolved player interaction to grade school level. It's not just the age of players at fault, teens will always be little punks, if they are old enough to be little punks then they are old enough to have someone stand up to their bad behavior. LET PLAYERS GET THEIR FEELINGS HURT, LET THEM GROW. 

  I want to log in and play a GAME. I want to play my best, think, use TACT. I play games as a form of meditation, to be in the zone. I feel it's beneficial. I'm old and it keeps me sharp, I feel good when I'm deep into a game. Why is it that even in top single digit %, can I not fully play the GAME? Why can I not stand up to idiots without infraction? This was one of my favorites, top notch all around EXCEPT in player moderation where Riot has failed at a unprecedented level... that will effect future games for years. This is like prison culture on the streets, this is the Compton of gaming. 

 Hey Riot: BAN PLAYERS WHO LOG IN AND REFUSE TO TRY. CHANGE PLAYER BEHAVIOR WITH INFORMATION, ON HOW TO WIN WHILE BEHIND, OR HOW A COUPLE DEATHS BEHIND IS NOT A LOSS. STOP FORCE FEEDING KIDS LCS BULLSHIT, DELETE ALL VIDEOS THAT SHOW PARENTS APPRECIATING AND UNDERSTANDING THEIR CHILDREN ONCE THEY ARE "PRO" GAMERS. YOU HAVE CREATED A GENERATION DELUSIONAL GAMERS.

replies.body: tldr: im an asshole and i want other people to stop having feelings so i can continue to be an asshole.{{champion:17}}
maybe its not that riot is creating a safe space, but that Riot wants people to have fun in their games without some toxic asshole telling them they suck ass.
I appreciate people who can bring their own builds into the game.  I hate when people think every champ has to be built the exact same way.  You can still go 20-2 with an off meta-build.

I agree, this game is one huge safe space for babies. The feeders who are -7 are quick to call you "toxic" for calling them out.They have a leftist mentality, they ignore the pile of sh** that is their feeding and focus on the fly that is called "toxic". I laugh every time I see someone that is -5 telling someone that is +x that their bad attitude is what is losing the game. They do not really believe what they say, but they know full well that the system is in favor of this irrational mentality. If you look at the report system, it is filled with SJW terms. There have been games where I have fed, and I accept every insult strangers throw at me over an online game. Why should I get a wink for losing them a 40 minute game? But what amazes me the most is that on some of those games where I have fed, the white knights come to my rescue!

I honestly don't get the behavior moderation on here. 

I've seen people say and do the most hideous things and still play the game without any visible restrictions day after day.  Then, someone says something far less incendiary and they get hit as if they were a repeat offender.  It appears Riot likes to randomly take down some toxic players and then do nothing for a period of time, where these people do whatever they want in the meantime.

Sometimes it gets so bad I just don't even say a word, and wait for the game to be over.  If I say something, it'll possibly be a suspension, if I don't say anything the game ends at some point soon and I can go try and find a winnable one.  But one thing that should exist is a stand your ground rule, where if somebody flames you you have the right to flame them right back within reason.  If somebody calls me a name, I should be able to call them a name, and that's the end of it unless they say something again, in which case I get a response without punishment (within reason, no death threats/wishes/etc) because trolls get away with it by using tons of accounts and there's no defense for the regular player who just wants to use one account and play a game.

We need to wake up folks.  Ban smurfs in ranked, rework the behavioral system, throw out designers with biases towards/against certain champions, and get this game back where it was 3-4 years ago when I was dragged on by friends talking how great it was.  Those same friends quit last year, citing how awful the game has become in many different ways.   A few common sense changes and League could get back to a better state where people look forward to each new game rather than dreading who they are matched with.

> If somebody calls me a name, I should be able to call them a name

An eye for an eye makes the whole world blind.  In this case, it makes everyone a toxic jerk and distracts them from attempting to pull a win from what is likely an unfavorable situation.
Except the last guy

You should be able to say whatever you want, to whoever you want to. Somebody wishes I die of cancer? That's great, it wont happen because somebody said it. The censor police has taken over public discourse and thus created a victimhood culture. A culture where everyone has the right to be offended! But why do you want to ban smurfs in ranked? Can you give me a reason?

I believe in reasonable limits - wishing somebody die or threatening to come kill them needs to be dealt with and has no place in a game.  People trash talk each other all the time in competitive games of any sort, and there needs to be latitude with that, but not to the point where people can basically describe the type of cancer in graphic detail they want you to die from, as imaginative as some of them are.

The smurfs, oh dear lord.  Why do you NOT want smurfs to be banned in ranked?  Remember, a smurf is the low level account of somebody much higher.  So you aren't fighting a particularly good bronze II or silver III, you're really facing a Plat IV who is helping his buddies get two tiers higher than they deserve.  When I did ranked for a while, I was often matched against people 2-3 tiers above me and frankly, how do you win?  Especially when you're new to the game and have no realistic chance to beat somebody who played for four years? I honestly believe smurfs ruin the game because you have no idea why this person can buy a champ and go 32-0 with them on their first time and play them better than you can, with over a hundred games experience, and find out "oh, that dude's a smurf" and realize how stacked the deck really is.

Frankly, I know we'll never see the day Riot bans smurfs in ranked but the concept of banning people for boosting and then allowing them to be boosted by their buddies on accounts that are PURPOSELY lower ranked than their mains is beyond despicable and makes for a really questionable experience - how can they justify it?

Just avoid calling them noobs or anything that will tilt them further.  It may make you feel a little better about the loss, but it doesn't actually improve your situation in the slightest.

Instead of "calling them out," just give helpful suggestions to keep them from losing further.  For instance, tell them to last hit under tower and ping mia whenever their opponent leaves vision.  Giving advice won't get you banned and actually improves the odds of you making a comeback.
Ever tied being help full and get the great response of stfu and dont tell me what to do! no point in trying to help when thats what you get 90% of the time back being a team player....
Then what you simply do, is shut up.

The other 10% of the time (more like 30-50% for me at least) you get your teammate back in the game, and manage to delay the game enough that the fed enemy no longer has much of an advantage.

Either way, "calling them out" will never do more good than offering advice and sympathy to them.

Soon as I see someone say 'safe space', I know they've been an asshole.

There's a simple way to avoid getting banned: Just don't be a jerk. If someone is acting up then just mute and report them rather than harass them. Just don't do or say anything that you know will get you in trouble and you'll be fine. I've been playing this game since S2 and have never been warned nor banned. How? Because I don't turn into a raging lunatic the moment that things don't go my way.

This has nothing to do with Riot "catering to babies" or 'creating a safe space" or any other excuse like that, this is about treating others how you want to be treated. If all you want to do is be a jerk to people when you don't get your way (note that's how a child acts by the way) then online multiplayer games are not for you.

P.S. Post your reform card if you actually want to discuss your ban.

This is not a "I got banned so im venting post." My most recent account is not banned, and they can ban it if they want knowing this history.

  Your experience may differ for many reasons. Mine is that I don't bring bad behavior into this game, it's here. My playstyle brings it out. I don't dwell on it, this is my vent and I'm done. This game is toxic and somewhat broken in that you can't expect to login and play the full game because of Moba Mental Illness. 

 I'm pointing out that Riot's attempts have made this game worse. They need to focus on teaching players to play the game, not to quit, not to blame others. They need to stop the over produced cult-like videos about LCS players. LCS itself is fine, its fun, I'm happy to see that sort of appreciation for gaming. But they are going too far and it's messing with kids heads. 

 A starting point is to loosen the tension in any way possible that ends with more full games being played out, that are not decided by over emotional players in the first couple minutes. And then they need to slowly back off chat based ban system. I don't suggest opening the floodgates, think of it like a dam.. they blocked it and its starting to overflow.
I'm sorry but if I see a Pantheon going full AP in ranked match, I'm reporting.

This is a good example. 

Riot has stated many times they do not enforce meta. While I do not agree AP Panth is viable, pretend a situation arises where AP Panth is viable but not known yet. 

 Now if you spend the game saying how hard you are going to report your teammate, and your AP Panth is actually trying, who is going to get reported??? AP Panth of course. So inadvertently AP Panth will get banned IF he responds to toxic behavior. The mildest of comment, over time and accumulation of reports, will cause a ban. This is part of the reason this game has been more stagnant as of late, when even item progression is an opportunity for harassment. 

 Early on I got reported for playing Nid mid or top, there was a time when she was SUPPORT ONLY IN RANKED. I got reported and even harassed by a Rioter for playing Lulu mid years ago, PRE NERF, PRE-Disovery of OP.

 The first week Ekko came out, I was playing tanky AP builds.. very similar to the ones deemed OP before he was perma banned and nerfed. It was insanely strong, but I was unable to reap the benefit of my knowledge because of this playerbase. 

 This is not my only reason for quitting and not enjoying the game, just one aspect. The main of course is that I can't expect to login and play a real game. Every time I logged in, I was gambling with at least 20 minutes of my life.


 Also, to be clear. I never called out anyone for being bad or looked to insult anyone. I only engaged people verbally who had been doing so to me, usually for several minutes with no responses... and then I launched my assaults. Usually calm tempered and matter of fact logic about what the actual dynamic of the situation was, and why they were wrong for calling me out, and how them typing all game and not playing contributed more to a loss than their accusations even if they were true. That sort of stuff.. Sometimes I destroyed people in chat and thats were perma bans came in, every one of them deserved it. 

 If the game couldn't possibly be stimulating because it was not happening, it was easy for me to use my focus elsewhere, putting idiots in their place. So you can project anyone that ever made you mad on me, but consider that I would only insult you if you started it AND you were persistent and wrong.
